animationmanager.AnimationManager

animationmanager.AnimationManager Class Reference

The AnimationManager class handles loading and instantiating Animations and their Polygons. More...

Detailed Description

The AnimationManager class handles loading and instantiating Animations and their Polygons.

Member Function Documentation

def animationmanager.AnimationManager.copy (   self,
  name 
)

Create a copy of the given dict (including copies of the animations involved) and return it.

def animationmanager.AnimationManager.loadAnimations (   self,
  spriteName,
  shouldCreateCopy = True 
)

Load information on the named animation.

Parameters:
name The path to a directory containing directories of image files (individual animations) and a spriteConfig.py file that holds information on those animations.
shouldCreateCopy True if the animation needs to be a copy of the cached version, false otherwise. If it isn't a copy, then we'll end up with multiple references to the same animation...but this doesn't matter for things like terrain, and having each terrain block have its own animation is slow.

A cache of animation data, to prevent redundant loading of modules.
